vague_description: The dentist must decide how to allocate limited resources of resin and pain killers to fill cavities in molars and canines while meeting specific requirements.
detailed_description: A dentist has \param{TotalResin} units of resin to fill cavities in both molars and canines. Molars require \param{ResinMolar} units of resin and \param{PainKillerMolar} units of pain killer. Canines require \param{ResinCanine} units of resin and \param{PainKillerCanine} units of pain killer. Since this dentist sees more cavities in canines, at least \param{MinCaninePercentage} of cavities filled must be in canines. In addition, the dentist must reserve materials to fill at least \param{MinMolars} molars. How many of each type of teeth should the dentist schedule to fill to minimize the amount of pain killer needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total amount of pain killer needed for filling cavities
target_constraints: Total resin used for all cavities is at most TotalResin
At least MinCaninePercentage of cavities filled must be canines
At least MinMolars molars must be filled
Number of molars to be filled is non-negative
Number of canines to be filled is non-negative
target_parameters: Units of resin required per molar
Units of resin required per canine
Units of pain killer required per molar
Units of pain killer required per canine
Minimum percentage of cavities to be filled in canines
Minimum number of molars required to be filled
